document.docAuthor: Fonseca-Ferreira, Rafael, Guadanucci, José Paulo Leite, Yamamoto, Flávio Uemori & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.docTitle: Idiops duocordibus Fonseca-Ferreira, Guadanucci & Brescovit 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spiders of the genus Idiops Perty, 1833 (Araneae, Idiopidae), with description of four new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Figs 3B , 17A–L
The specific epithet refers to the heart-shaped receptacles of the female genitalia.

Amazonas
• 1 ♂ ; Manaus , Reserva Florestal Adolpho Ducke ; 3°0′27″ S , 59°56′22.92″ W ;
9 Sep. 1991
; H. Höfer and T. Gasnier leg.; INPA 4592
•
1 ♂ ; Manaus , Reserva Florestal Adolpho Ducke ;
14–24 Jul. 1991
; A.D. Brescovit leg.; MCN 21485.
–
Pará
• 2 ♂♂ ; Vitória do Xingu , Ilha Taboca ; 3°23′12.7″ S , 51°57′26.2″ W ;
23 Nov. 2000
; F. Oliveira leg.; MPEG 0112 , MPEG 0114
.
Male ( holotype MPEG 0124)
HABITUS. See Fig. 17A .
MEASUREMENTS. TBL 10, CL 4.6, CW 4, LL 0.5, LW 0.7, SL 2.4, SW 2.2.

LEGS. Tibia, metatarsus and tarsus I as shown in Fig. 17G . Leg I with double tibial apophysis. Leg I tibial apophysis with apical branch twice the size of basal branch and with a conspicuous spine ( Fig. 17G–I ). Pseudoscopula: tarsus I weakly covered ( Fig. 17G ), tarsus II–IV totally covered.
Female ( paratype MPEG 0123)
HABITUS. See Fig. 17J .
MEASUREMENTS. TBL 9.9, CL 5.5, CW 4,8, LL 0.9, LW 1.2, SL 3.4, SW 2.9.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 17.
Idiops duocordibus Fonseca-Ferreira, Guadanucci & Brescovit
sp. nov. A–I . ♂, holotype (MPEG 0124). A . Prosoma (dorsal view). B . Prosoma (ventral view). C . Part of palp (retrolateral view). D–F . Palpal bulb. D . Dorsal view. E . Retrolateral view. F . Prolateral view. G . Tibia, metatarsus and tarsus I (prolateral view). H . Tibial apophysis (prolateral view). I . Tibial apophysis and metatarsus I (dorsal view). J–L . ♀, paratype (MPEG 0123). J . Prosoma (dorsal view). K . Prosoma (ventral view). L . Genitalia (dorsal view). Abbreviation: K = keel. Scale bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Brazil . Distributed in phytophysiognomies in the Amazon, with records for the North region (western Amazonas and northwestern Pará) ( Fig. 3B )
